snippet.textDisplay: It's not so much the song itself, but what it represents. Somehow they composed a piece of music that perfectly represents a feeling experienced in childhood, one of a simpler time. That's how I feel when I hear this song.

snippet.textDisplay: This song perfectly captures the feel of 16 bit JRPGs. I love modern games, and some truly great masterpieces are created every generation including this current one, but I still consider the 16 bit days the greatest era of gaming so far.
snippet.textOriginal: This song perfectly captures the feel of 16 bit JRPGs. I love modern games, and some truly great masterpieces are created every generation including this current one, but I still consider the 16 bit days the greatest era of gaming so far.

snippet.textDisplay: earthbound was nothing like other "jrpgs", and that was on purpose. it was themed to be like the west in almost every way imaginable. and for that reason it stands out and is one of the greatest works of video game art ever. you don't know shit, "lloyd".
snippet.textOriginal: earthbound was nothing like other "jrpgs", and that was on purpose. it was themed to be like the west in almost every way imaginable. and for that reason it stands out and is one of the greatest works of video game art ever. you don't know shit, "lloyd".

snippet.textDisplay: +Lloyd Martin It's true, really. As great as all the other generations are, nothing can really compete with the 16-bit era. The sheer amount of instant classics that were created within those short 6 years was simply astounding. You just don't see that kind of quality in games nowadays.
snippet.textOriginal: +Lloyd Martin It's true, really. As great as all the other generations are, nothing can really compete with the 16-bit era. The sheer amount of instant classics that were created within those short 6 years was simply astounding. You just don't see that kind of quality in games nowadays.

snippet.textDisplay: @DoomsdayOdd Just looked them up. They were called Territorial Oaks and they always exploded at the end of the battle after defeating them. You might've gotten lucky and missed them if you went through Peaceful Rest Valley really fast. One of easiest places to die in the game IMO since you only have Ness.
snippet.textOriginal: @DoomsdayOdd Just looked them up. They were called Territorial Oaks and they always exploded at the end of the battle after defeating them. You might've gotten lucky and missed them if you went through Peaceful Rest Valley really fast. One of easiest places to die in the game IMO since you only have Ness.

snippet.textDisplay:
The official track listing calls this "Boy Meets Girl (Twoson)." How cute.

I have a list of all the songs you've posted since I'm so OCD, and the only game that's had more entries on your list is Chrono Trigger. But you still haven't gotten to Smiles and Tears, dammit! It's going to be at X00, I hope.

The official track listing calls this "Boy Meets Girl (Twoson)." How cute.

I have a list of all the songs you've posted since I'm so OCD, and the only game that's had more entries on your list is Chrono Trigger. But you still haven't gotten to Smiles and Tears, dammit! It's going to be at X00, I hope.

snippet.textDisplay: @AmericanVideoGames In my opinion, Mother 3 is so much superior to Earthbound in every way. From that certain event in the beginning of the game to the end of the story, I've discovered happiness, loneliness, anger, hatred and sadness; all in one tight cartridge.
snippet.textOriginal: @AmericanVideoGames In my opinion, Mother 3 is so much superior to Earthbound in every way. From that certain event in the beginning of the game to the end of the story, I've discovered happiness, loneliness, anger, hatred and sadness; all in one tight cartridge.

snippet.textDisplay: After so many entries, I don't really have much more to say about the amazing Earthbound. I really liked all the towns in this game, they all had their own feel and atmosphere. Twoson felt like a really relaxing and peaceful city, riding your bike, checking out the big stores or the markets outside in the sun. Oh, and hippies.
snippet.textOriginal: After so many entries, I don't really have much more to say about the amazing Earthbound. I really liked all the towns in this game, they all had their own feel and atmosphere. Twoson felt like a really relaxing and peaceful city, riding your bike, checking out the big stores or the markets outside in the sun. Oh, and hippies.
